alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Lee; Macon; Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, north central Bullock, Macon and northwestern Russell Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Beans Mill to near Tuskegee National Forest to near Hardaway. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Tuskegee, Union Springs, Notasulga, Shorter, Beulah, Uchee, Beans Mill, Lake Tuskegee, Auburn University, Tuskegee National Forest, Beauregard, Davisville, Bleecker, Liverpool, Hardaway, Victoryland, Society Hill and Griffen Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern and east central Alabama.
